Compute the area of the region that lies above the graph of $y = |x - 1| + |x - 3|$ but below the graph of $y = 8.$
inference:
The graph of $y = |x - 1| + |x - 3|$ is composed of two line segments. For $x < 1$, 

$$y = |x - 1| + |x - 3| = -x + 1 - x + 3 = 2 - 2x,$$

and for $x \geq 1$, 

$$y = |x - 1| + |x - 3| = x - 1 + x - 3 = 2x - 4.$$

So the region in question is bounded above by the horizontal line $y = 8$, below by the graph of $y = 2 - 2x$ for $x < 1$ and the graph of $y = 2x - 4$ for $x \geq 1$, and on the sides by the vertical lines $x = 1$ and $x = 3$.

The area of the region is therefore

$$\begin{split} \int_0^1 (8 - (2 - 2x)) \ dx + \int_1^3 (8 - (2x - 4)) \ dx & = \int_0^1 (6 + 2x) \ dx + \int_1^3 (4 - 2x) \ dx \\\ & = \left[ 6x + x^2 \right]_0^1 + \left[ 4x - x^2 \right]_1^3 \\\ & = (6 + 1) + (12 - 9) = 8.\end{split}$$

Final Answer: $\boxed{8}.$ I hope it is correct.
